newsitem.title: ARGENTINA: Argentine official denies debt buyback plan rumors.
newsitem.headline: Argentine official denies debt buyback plan rumors.

text.p: Rumors that Argentina is planning a debt swap similar to the one in Brazil circulated in local markets Tuesday, but a government official denied such a plan
"There are rumors of a buyback of Brady debt and the launch of a 30-year bond," said one trader at a local bank.
"There is no such plan. The rumors are circulating because Brazil is carrying out such an operation," an official from the Economy Ministry told Reuters.
Another trader at a foreign bank said the rumor was a "logical consequence" of the Brazilian debt swap deal.

Brazil's deal allows investors to tender their par, discount or C bonds for a 30-year global bond issue or to purchase outright the new issue. The offer expires Tuesday at 1900 GMT and results are expected to be announced Wednesday.
The second trader added that it was still only a rumor that Argentina was planning a swap.
"I do not think there are any offers (to carry out the deal) yet to the government," he said.
Goldman Sachs & Co and J.P. Morgan Securities are lead managing the Brazil 30-year global issue.
A third trader, asked about a possible Argentine debt buyback, said: "For now there is absolutely nothing."
